Headline: Two Days After 'Doomsday Fish' Appears In California, Earthquake Hits Los Angeles
Content: This rare deep-sea fish was discovered just before a 4.4-magnitude earthquake struck Los Angeles. It was transported to NOAA for examination.

Headline: Back-To-Back Earthquakes Of 4.9 Magnitude Hit Kashmir's Baramulla
Content: Two back-to-back earthquakes measuring 4.9 and 4.8 on the Richter scale occurred in the Kashmir Valley on Tuesday. However, no loss of life or damage to property has been so far reported from anywhere.

Headline: 5.1 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Japan, Tremors Felt In Central Tokyo
Content: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 5.1 struck off the Japanese prefecture of Ibaraki, just northeast of Tokyo, the country's weather agency said.

Headline: Shiveluch Volcano Erupts In Russia After 7.0 Magnitude Earthquake
Content: Russia's Shiveluch volcano in the Kamchatka region erupted after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake that struck off the eastern coast of the country, local media reported on Sunday.

Headline: 7.0 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Russia, Several Aftershocks Recorded
Content: A magnitude 7.0 earthquake struck off the coast of Russia's far-eastern Kamchatka Peninsula early Sunday morning local time, according to the regional earthquake monitoring service.

Headline: 6.3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Taiwan: Weather Agency
Content: A 6.3 magnitude earthquake struck 34 km (21.13 miles) off Taiwan's eastern city of Hualien on Friday, the island's weather administration said, with no immediate reports of damage.

Headline: "Building Was Swaying": Taiwan Hit By 5.4 Magnitude Earthquake
Content: A 5.4 magnitude earthquake hit northeastern Taiwan on Thursday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) said, with the tremor shaking buildings in Taipei but causing no major damage.

Headline: Japan Lifts Megaquake Warning, Says Citizens Can Return To Normal Life
Content: Japan on Thursday ended its call for higher-than-usual risks of a major earthquake, one week after a strong tremor on the edge of the Nankai Trough seabed zone caused the government to issue its first-ever megaquake advisory.

Headline: Japan Megaquake Alert Triggers Mass Hotel Cancellations, Disrupts Tourism
Content: Japan's unprecedented megaquake advisory has prompted thousands of hotel cancellations in areas flagged as high-risk, dealing businesses a heavy blow in what would have been one of the busiest seasons, hoteliers said Tuesday.

Headline: 5.5 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Syria
Content: A magnitude 5.5 earthquake struck 28 km east of the central city of Hama, according to the Syrian National Earthquake Centre.

Headline: Japanese Urged To Avoid Panic Buying After Megaquake Fear Spreads
Content: Authorities in Japan urged people to avoid hoarding as anxiety over a possible megaquake triggered a spike Saturday in demand for disaster kits and daily necessities.

Headline: Indian Embassy In Japan Issues Advisory After Experts Warn Of 'Megaquake'
Content: The Indian Embassy in Japan issued a mega-quake advisory for Indian citizens residing in Japan on Friday, urging them to prepare for natural disasters after a strong magnitude 7.1 earthquake occurred on Thursday.

Headline: 5.3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Tokyo After Japan Issues Megaquake Alert
Content: A magnitude-5.3 earthquake hit Tokyo and surrounding areas on Friday evening, the Japan Meteorological Agency said, a day after the government issued a first-ever advisory about the risk of a huge earthquake on the country's Pacific coast.

Headline: Explainer: Why Did Japan Scientists Issue 'Megaquake' Advisory
Content: Japan's earthquake scientists say the country should prepare for a possible "megaquake" one day that could kill hundreds of thousands of people -- although they stress the warning does not mean a colossal tremor is imminent.

Headline: Japan PM Fumio Kishida Cancels Central Asia Trip Amid Megaquake Warnings
Content: Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Friday cancelled a trip to Central Asia after earthquake scientists warned the country should prepare for a possible "megaquake".
